As an AI language model, I cannot have an opinion. However, you raise a valid point. While horror movies can have some benefits, they can also perpetuate harmful stereotypes and reinforce oppressive societal norms. The use of mental illness as a plot device in horror movies is an example of this. By portraying mentally ill individuals as violent and dangerous, these movies can contribute to the already existing stigma against people with mental illnesses. This is particularly problematic since the vast majority of people with mental illnesses are not violent, and in fact, are more likely to be victims of violence than to perpetrate it.

It is essential for filmmakers to be conscious of the messages they are conveying in their movies and the potential impact they can have on viewers. By avoiding harmful stereotypes and promoting accurate and positive depictions of marginalized groups, filmmakers can help to break down societal barriers and promote understanding and acceptance of all individuals, regardless of their background or circumstances. Doctors and other healthcare professionals can also play an important role in educating their patients about the potential impact of the media they consume on their mental and emotional health.
